Job title: Java Full-Stack Software Developer, Genedata Screener
Content: Java Full-Stack Software Developer, Genedata Screener  Java Full-Stack Software Developer, Genedata Screener, CH-Basel   The Position The Genedata Screener Development team creates and maintains scientific software products. Continuous progress in science means that these products constantly evolve and many new features are added with every release. This requires solid software architecture and continuous evolution. Best software development practices such as test-driven development or clean code are therefore not only buzzwords for us but key factors for our long-term success. As part of the development team you will be wearing all the hats. You will be helping users by developing new features, removing complications by designing a meaningful User Experience, saving someone's day by fixing bugs, changing someone's life by understanding their problem and creating a solution that works, saving the support people a lot of trouble by heavily testing our software, teaching new users by writing readable documentation, figuring out why remote streams stop working after 8MB of data, taking your fellow developers to the next level by creating development tools, rejoicing when you finally make complex code understandable, giving power to our customers by designing public APIs. We are looking for developers who are interested in writing beautiful code and build great products that make a difference. In all these your ideas and your creativity matters. This full-time position is based at our offices in Basel, Switzerland.   Key Responsibilities  Develop new functionality according to a product backlog Maintain product Explore new technologies Work on professional service projects    Your Profile  Essential Skills and Experience:   BSc, MSc, or Ph.D. in computer science, bioinformatics, or related fields At least three years of professional experience in product development Expert knowledge in Java Excellent communication and presentation skills   Additional Preferred Skills and Experience:   Front-end technologies such as Swing, SWT or JavaFX Modern web technologies such as Angular or React Building tools such as Gradle, Gulp, or NodeJS/NPM    The Company Genedata is an exceptional company. With over two decades of success in research informatics due to closely-knit teams of scientists, developers and business experts, Genedata has achieved steady and continuous growth since inception. As a private and majority employee-owned organization, we empower each employee to be a contributing voice in the company operations and evolution. Our collective expertise in research informatics, combined with our open and scalable computational solutions, makes us the leading software provider in R&D informatics for biotech, pharmaceuticals, and related life sciences. We are headquartered in Basel, Switzerland and have subsidiaries in Germany, US, UK, Japan and Singapore.   About Genedata Screener® Genedata Screener® analyzes, visualizes, and manages screening data from in-vitro screening assay technologies across the enterprise, including very complex as well as ultra-high throughput experiments. Its screening-oriented business logic enables rapid processing and comprehensive analysis of complete campaigns.    Are You Interested? If you are interested in this position, please submit us your CV and motivation letter. Genedata is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Genedata only accepts CVs and resumes directly from candidates. Personnel recruitment agencies need not respond.    Apply now               Display original ad

Scientific Account Manager, Biopharma Discovery  Scientific Account Manager, Biopharma Discovery, CH-Basel     The Position We are looking for a Scientific Account Manager for our product Genedata Biologics™, a first-in-class workflow system that has been designed to increase the efficiency and quality of the biopharmaceutical discovery process. As a member of our professional services team, you will be working closely with customers on a wide variety of projects and tasks with an emphasis on enterprise software deployment projects and scientific consulting projects. This is an interdisciplinary, multi-faceted position that offers an exciting opportunity to streamline biologics discovery research.  The position offers a high level of interactivity and responsibility in a quickly growing company, and the opportunity to work as part of a strong international team.  This full-time position is located at our headquarter office in Basel, Switzerland.   Key Responsibilities Work on scientific and technical customer projects, including process analysis projects, scientific and technical requirements projects, large enterprise system deployment projects, data migration projects, system integration projects and technology transfer projects, as well as user and technical training. Amongst other responsibilities, the successful candidate will be expected to:  Prepare and deliver scientific and technical presentations Conduct customer requirement analyses Functionally specify and document customer need Plan and deliver training at customer sites Provide expert support and troubleshooting Manage software installations and upgrades for customers Provide scientific and technical support for sales and business development Coordinate with product managers, professional services and product development teams    Your Profile  Essential Skills and Experience:   MSc or PhD degree in biology, biotechnology, bioprocess or chemical engineering, quantitative biology, bioinformatics, or a related field Minimum 3 years of experience in either biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries or software industry Self-motivated and independent candidates that are curious, inquisitive, and able to present complex topics simply and rationally Excellent written and verbal communication skills, fluency in English Experience and talent at giving presentations Strong initiative and dedication to quality of work as well as the ability to interact productively with scientists and IT experts   Additional Preferred Skills and Experience:   Experience in biopharma R&D, antibody discovery, protein engineering (incl. bispecific antibodies, antibody drug conjugates/ADCs), protein expression and purification, bioanalytics, or lab automation is a significant plus Practical experience software development, computer fluency, and familiarity with general IT concepts are advantageous Fluency in German is a plus    The Company Genedata is an exceptional company. With over two decades of success in research informatics due to closely-knit teams of scientists, developers and business experts, Genedata has achieved steady and continuous growth since inception. As a private and majority employee-owned organization, we empower each employee to be a contributing voice in the company operations and evolution. Our collective expertise in research informatics, combined with our open and scalable computational solutions, makes us the leading software provider in R&D informatics for biotech, pharmaceuticals, and related life sciences. We are headquartered in Basel, Switzerland and have subsidiaries in Germany, US, UK, Japan and Singapore.   About Genedata Biologics With award-winning platforms and deep domain expertise, Genedata solutions boost the efficiency, throughput, and quality of large-molecule R&D. Genedata platforms support the entire biologics workflow, from screening, protein engineering and optimization, expression, purification, MS characterization, analytics and QC, and developability assessment to upstream and downstream process development and drug formulation.   If you are interested in this position, please submit us your CV and motivation letter. Genedata is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Genedata only accepts CVs and resumes directly from candidates. Personnel recruitment agencies need not respond.    Apply now               Display original ad

Associate InternAssociate Interns join our offices and practices (e.g. Digital McKinsey, Marketing & Sales) around the world for 8 - 10 weeks, usually in the summer, to work in teams and directly with our clients.  When you join McKinsey as an Associate Intern, you are joining a firm that will challenge you and invest in your professional development. In this role you will work on the best teams to help the best organizations in the world – in private, public, and social sectors – solve their most difficult problems. You will also work with many experts, from data scientists and researchers to software and app designers. If you are interested in joining a specific practice, please indicate this in your office/practice preference (combinations are possible). Internship opportunities vary by office, so please check with your campus recruiter to determine what possibilities are available if you have questions. If you are not working directly with a campus recruiter, you may check with the office of interest to learn more. To learn more about how we help our clients and where you fit in, visit our careers site.  
You'll work in teams of typically 3 - 5 consultants, playing an active role in all aspects of client engagement. This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. You'll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members. Associate Interns receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on their teams. This support includes a Partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career as well as formal training in your first few weeks as an intern. Additionally, you'll receive guidance and support from your local office or practice in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network. While all consultants develop specialized knowledge and a focused program as they progress with McKinsey, most are initially very broad in their focus, meaning they do not need specific industry or functional expertise to be successful. For consultants who join McKinsey as experienced professionals, this can mean building on previous knowledge or developing unique experience in an area that is completely new. You will likely intersect with many elements of our firm's work including Digital McKinsey, Implementation, and New Ventures - either by collaborating on teams or working with colleagues from these groups.Display original ad

Social Media Team LeadCompany description ProtonMail was born at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) in 2013 when a group of scientists and engineers envisioned an email service that empowers users to own their private data and keeps them safe from mass surveillance. Since then, ProtonMail has grown to become the world’s largest secure email service, with over 15 million users and a profitable business model. We are looking for passionate people to join our growing team and help us build a suite of security tools that safeguard privacy online build a better Internet.     Role description As an experienced social media marketing manager, you’ll lead the Community & Reputation Team. This team is in charge of engaging followers and responding to their comments and questions on all our social media channels, our online communities (such as UserVoice), third-party communities, and the comments section on our blogs. They also keep an eye on reviews published on TrustPilot, the various App Stores, and third-party websites.    You’ll also be in charge of our brand reputation. This involves monitoring the Internet for mentions of our brand and responding accordingly.   Together with the team, you will define the strategy for these channels, create compelling content, encourage community engagement, and expand our reach.   If you’re a results-driven marketer, feel comfortable taking initiative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, this is a great opportunity to play a pivotal role in a fast-growing company. You will have a concrete impact on the future of the business as a whole.   Responsibilities   Grow, lead, and mentor the Community & Reputation Team.   Create, manage, and improve a community strategy that incorporates social media networks, blogs, online communities, forums, review sites, and other outlets where we can engage with people.   Monitor, manage, and improve the brand reputation across online and offline outlets, but also across spam, abuse, and other report systems.   Lead the creation of high-quality, engaging multimedia content for all the community channels, including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Reddit, YouTube, Mastodon, blog comments, etc.   Take ownership, from design to execution, of all our community campaigns.   Research, test, optimize, and scale new channels, techniques, and technologies.   Increase ROI, user engagement, and follower base by testing different campaigns, creatives, target audiences, timing, and landing pages.   Continually refine the Community & Reputation Team’s processes, metrics, and tools.    Coordinate with internal teams and creative agencies on the development, implementation, and optimization of creative output.   Create and present weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports and analysis.   Keep abreast of the newest trends, innovations, and technologies in the online advertising industry.  Display original ad

Epidemiologist (80-100% )   Back to Previous Page     Job ID273442BR  Position TitleEpidemiologist (80-100%*)    Apply to Job    Job Description 80! That’s the number of Novartis products that the Quantitative Safety & Epidemiology (QSE) team is responsible for. QSE is an interdisciplinary group in the global Patient Safety organization; we help regulators, physicians and patients to understand the benefits and risks of assigned drugs, by asking the right questions and by applying the most appropriate scientific methods. In your role as Epidemiologist, you will provide epidemiology and risk management support to our safety management teams. You will actively take part in the discussion and assessment of safety signals and safety risks. Further, you will provide timely epidemiologic input into regulatory reports and risk management strategy for assigned products. Your responsibilities will include:• Develop, implement and monitor epidemiology and risk management strategy of one or several drugs• Work in close collaboration with the Quantitative Safety Scientist, the Brand Safety Leader and other team members of the Safety Management Team (e.g. GPMD, DRA Lead, Lead Statistician).• Design, conduct, analyze, interpret and report simple and complex epidemiological studies using databases such as CPRD and MarketScan. Have the scientific oversight and management of non-interventional studies if outsourced• Be responsible for the epidemiological sections of documents for the Health Authorities, including but not restricted to product submissions, Health Authority requests, RMPs, Safety Update reports, Labeling documents, Safety Profiling Plans, RiskMAPs, and Expert Statements. Put epidemiology information into context of information from other data sources• Generate systematic reviews using best practice methodologies to evaluate published evidence, and provide commentaries on manuscripts and publications of epidemiological studies of importance to Novartis• Maintain knowledge/expertise of existing epidemiological data sources which may be suitable to address issues involving safety of products, identification of characteristics of study populations and development of the knowledge of therapeutic areas• Actively participate in scientific meetings by giving presentations        Minimum requirements What you’ll bring to the role:• Master’s degree or comparable in epidemiology, statistics, health services research or related areas (PhD preferred)• Business-level English (oral and written)• 2+ years of experience in positions with increasing relevant responsibilities in the Pharmaceutical Industry• 4+ years of postgraduate experience in epidemiology as reflected in research projects, publications etc preferred• Computing ability, including knowledge of specialized epidemiological/statistical packages (advanced level, SAS or R experience desirable)• Experience in designing, conducting, analyzing and interpreting epidemiological studies and working with large electronic health records databases• Ability to critically appraise and synthesize epidemiological literature• Very good presentation skills WHY CONSIDER NOVARTIS?750 million. That’s how many lives our products touch. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives? We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are empowered to ask new questions, make bolder decisions and take smarter risks. We are Novartis. Join us and help us reimagine medicine. *Some restrictions on flexible working options may apply and will be discussed during interview if applicable. Praktikant Consulting & Business Development Wir sind ein Beratungs- und Implementierungsunternehmen, das nationale und internationale Firmen befähigt, das Digitalpotenzial zu erschliessen und dabei ihre Kunden- und Investorenbeziehungen schneller und smarter zu gestalten. Mit einem datenbasierten Ansatz und modernsten Lösungen beraten wir führende nationale und internationale Unternehmen zu den Themen Customer Intelligence, Marketing Analytics, Campaign Management, Marketing Operations, Multichannel Publishing und Marketing Automation. Gegründet 2009 in Steinhausen, Schweiz, beschäftigen wir derzeit über 70 Berater, Data Scientists und Implementierungsspezialisten in unseren vier Niederlassungen in Steinhausen, Los Angeles, Mailand und Singapur. Mehr auf gateB.com. Wir sind Mitglied des Brand Leadership Circle, eines Verbunds von unabhängig geführten Beratungsunternehmen im Kontext markenorientierter Unternehmensführung mit Sitz in Steinhausen ZG. Für unser wachsendes Team suchen wir einen  
 Als Praktikant unterstützt Du hauptsächlich unsere Geschäftsleitung und den Verkauf im Bereich der Neukundenakquise sowie die Consultants und Projektleiter bei der Einführung von Marketing-Lösungen und in der Betreuung von bestehenden Kunden. Du hast mit dieser Stelle die optimale Möglichkeit für einen spannenden und herausfordernden Berufseinstieg. Du kannst sogleich mit der Leitung und Koordination von Projekten grosse Eigenverantwortung übernehmen und lernst die Unternehmensführung eines vielseitigen und jungen Unternehmens aus erster Hand kennen.  Dein Aufgabengebiet umfasst folgende Haupttätigkeiten:  Business Development   Umsetzung von Marketingaktivitäten und Sales-Kampagnen, von der Marktanalyse bis hin zu direkten Kundenkontakten (via E-Mail, Calls und Meetings) und Pipeline Management Selbstständiges Erstellen von PowerPoint-Präsentationen; Koordination und inhaltliche Aufbereitung & Nachbereitung von Terminen   Beratung & Projektmanagement   Erhebung von Spezifikationen und Dokumentation der Kundenanforderungen im Rahmen von Systemprojekten (Content Management, Business Operations, Marketing Automation). Requirements Engineering und Management von Entwicklungs-Projekten, Epics und Stories Unterstützung an der Schnittstelle zwischen Kunden, Projektleiter und der Entwicklung Story-Testing und Sicherstellung der Deliverables hinsichtlich der Kunden-Bedürfnisse   Für diese Berufseinsteiger-Funktion mit hohem Gestaltungsfreiraum suchen wir einen kommunikativen, selbstständigen und dynamischen Bachelor- oder Masterabsolventen mit ausgeprägter Dienstleistungsmentalität und Freude am direkten Kundenkontakt.  Du bist ein offener und zugänglicher Teamplayer mit überdurchschnittlicher Leistungsbereitschaft und hoher Flexibilität, der ein dynamisches und junges Umfeld schätzt und mit unterschiedlichsten Mitarbeitenden zusammenarbeiten kann. Weiter bist Du eine analytisch denkende Persönlichkeit mit betriebswirtschaftlichem Verständnis, die gut organisieren kann und eine effiziente und effektive Arbeitsweise beherrscht. Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch wie auch Englisch setzen wir voraus. Zudem sind erste Praktikums- und/oder Berufserfahrung im Business Development, Sales oder Digital Business von Vorteil. Bist Du interessiert an einem unkomplizierten Arbeitsklima in einem engagierten und modernen Unternehmen? Falls wir Dein Interesse geweckt haben, bitten wir Dich, uns Dein vollständiges Bewerbungsdossier mit Foto zuzustellen. Wir freuen uns, Dich kennenzulernen. Display original ad

SEO Specialist   At a Glance:  Due to a propelling growth in our direct to consumer business, we are looking for a Search Engine Optimization Specialist to shape the future of On’s organic acquisition initiatives through searchand contentenhancement. You will work in a cross functional team together with digital channel owners, UX designers and developers working towards gold-standard SEO practices. You have a passion for improving on-site relevance and search visibility, while keeping the end user in the forefront. An entrepreneurial drive and strong hands-on execution will be imperative to shape and grow the brand. The position is to be based in Zurich.  Your Team:  As you might expect from a running brand, the E-Commerce team at On is a fast-paced place to be. This team of interdisciplinary all-stars are used to rapid turnaround times and ambitious targets. From engineers to designers, data scientists and digital marketing specialists, this is the team responsible for creating winning digital products and campaigns that run the length of the purchase funnel. The shared goal? Efficient growth at high speed – what else? Within the acquisition team specifically, you will collaborate closely with channel managers and own On’s organic performance, ensuring growth in line with paid channels.  Your Mission:   Enhance On’s global search visibility and grow organic performance on desktop, mobile, and potential app environments, through on-site, off-site and technical SEO activities Work closely with Content & Story team to guide and optimize content creation that drives new audiences to On’s website Work with in-house development team to ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented on newly developed code, while constantly striving to improve page speed Perform ongoing keyword discovery, expansion and optimization to discover new audience and content opportunities, growing On’s reach beyond it’s own website. Optimize copy and landing pages across On’s platforms(website,social, etc.) to enhance site relevance for users and search engines Maintain healthy and clean site indexation, recommending changes to website architecture, navigation, internal linking, content and other factors   Your Story:   In-depth knowledge of keyword research, SEO copywriting and the indexation and ranking behaviours of search engines +2-3 years' hands-on experience with SEO, from an on-site, off-site as well as technical perspective Solid experience with Google Analytics, Search Console, and other SEO knowledge bases and support tools You like to stay up to date on the latest trends and developments in our ever-changing industry, with ability to come up with creative solutions to propel growth Self-driven, entrepreneurial and excellent problem solver. Enjoys coming up with creative, data-backed solutions in a fast paced agile environment Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints a bonus Fluent in German and English   What we offer:  We offer a dynamic, challenging and sportive environment that has been ranked as the‘fastestgrowing sports company’ of its time. With offices across the globe, we are an international team who is hungry to innovate and build something incredible. We foster an active environment where each individual thrives for excellence and can achieve their full potential. This is where your work matters, you’re hands-on and your team members are amongst the very best in their respective disciplines and fields.  If you are driven to bring On to the next level, curious about the opportunity and want to be part of our growing team send us your application, and join the ONiverse! Business Analyst InternBusiness Analyst (BA) Interns join our offices and practices (e.g. Digital McKinsey, Operations) around the world for ~10 weeks, usually in the summer, to work in teams and directly with our clients.  When you join McKinsey as a Business Analyst Intern, you are joining a firm that will challenge you and invest in your professional development. In this role you will work on the best teams to help the best organizations in the world – in private, public, and social sectors – solve their most difficult problems. You will also work with many experts, from data scientists and researchers to software and app designers. If you are interested in joining a specific practice, please indicate this in your office/practice preference (combinations are possible). To learn more about how we help our clients and where you fit in, visit our careers site. 
You’ll work in teams of typically 3 – 5 consultants, playing an active role in all aspects of the client engagement.  This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. You’ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members. You’ll gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. Business Analysts Interns receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on their teams. This support includes introductory training as well as a Partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide you throughout your internship. You will work at the client site with your McKinsey colleagues and with the client team, owning a distinct piece of the project. Some examples of the specific work may include interviewing clients, leading client teams, building financial models, creating and delivering presentations, and working with McKinsey subject experts to develop perspectives and insights for the client. You will likely intersect with many elements of our firm's work including Digital McKinsey, Implementation, and New Ventures - either by collaborating on teams or working with colleagues from these groups. Our Business Analyst Intern program gives a group of undergraduate students and eligible graduate students first-hand experience with consulting at McKinsey. You would work in your host office for ~10 weeks. You will participate in an introductory training program, as well as a range of social activities to get to know your office and the firm. At the end of the summer, you may receive an offer to join us as a full-time Business Analyst after completion of your degree. Various locations in the U.S. and Canada typically host our Business Analyst Interns including many of our functional practices. A small number of international locations may also host interns.Display original ad
