Modeling and Simulation Engineer Modeling and Simulation Engineer Position: Modelling and Simulation engineer Aurora Company Overview Aurora Swiss Aerospace GmbH, started in Lucerne in 2013, is a research and prototype engineering company, specializing in Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) but also supporting the development of manned aircraft. Over 80 employees work in the areas of lightweight structures and autonomous systems. Aurora Swiss Aerospace can also draw on the 30 years of experience that Aurora Flight Sciences, our American parent company, has in the development, design, manufacturing, operations, and support of advanced UAS systems. Since 2017 Aurora is a subsidiary of The Boeing Company. Now Aurora’s speed and innovation is combined with Boeing’s size and strength, creating an unprecedented opportunity to lead the development of technologies and platforms for the future of aerospace mobility. Recent projects at Aurora Swiss Aerospace include the Odysseus large-scale solar-powered UAS, the Boeing Passenger Air Vehicle (a so-called “flying taxi” for Urban Air Mobility), and several on-going projects not yet unveiled to the public.   Position Overview We are seeking motivated mid-level engineers/scientists with strong background in areas of automation and autonomy; the applicant should be fast learner, open-minded and an excellent team player.  At Aurora we apply perception, controls, big data, deep learning, and optimization to novel algorithms and architecture development.  Cross-disciplinary interests are highly sought and unique initiatives are encouraged. The applicant to this position will contribute to the design of various simulation environments and will integrate autonomy under test into these simulations. The successful applicant will design the testing environment and integrate the autonomy into it, to test single-vehicle behaviors as well as the reaction of other systems to disruption events in network operations. Specific Responsibilities:  As an Intelligent Systems engineer/scientist you will work on cutting edge autonomy techniques for fleet management, coordination, and monitoring. Validate and verify requirements through the use of various type of: Agent based modeling, SILsim, HILsim. Set up Monte Carlo simulations and night runs, CI for smoother integration. Contribute in the design and validation process of functions and algorithms to be used for mission planning and multi-vehicle coordination. Implement SILsim integrating the SW under Verification and Validation (V&V). Prepare documentation to support design decisions and to resolve issues. Prepare presentations for design reviews.  Assist the project engineer in preparing for technical interchange meetings and technical program reviews.   Requirements   B.S. or M.S. in aerospace, electronic, electrical, mechanical, or software engineering, or math with an aerospace controls, robotics, and/or autonomy emphasis.  A Ph.D. is a plus. Demonstrated industry experience in airborne-ground SW-SW and/or SW-HW integration. Ability to set up, utilize, and maintain simulation and hardware-in-the-loop environments to develop, validate, and implement algorithms and software for real-time flight systems and ground elements. C / C++ , JAVA software development skills, especially in a Linux environment. Matlab Simulink experience. Requires excellent English written and oral communications skills.  Requires strong interpersonal skills and demonstrated success working in and contributing to a highly collaborative environment. Able to work with high level of independence and to adapt to plan changes in a highly dynamic environments.  Desired Experience  Understanding of Agent-based model simulation environments (example: ExtendSim). Experience with agile software development, sprint and incremental development. Experience with ground systems for agent control. Experience with unmanned vehicles.   Position open to Swiss and EU/EFTA citizens or holders of other Swiss work permits. If you are interested in this position, please send us your CV and you cover letter at: Recruiting_ASA@aurora.aero    We are not accepting CVs from recruitment agencies at this time; all sent CVs will be treated as direct applicants.   Display original ad

Asset Master Data Specialist - Pharma (w/m)     Morgan Sindall Professional Services ist – als Tochter des Morgan Sindall Konzerns – Teil eines weltweit erfolgreich agierenden Unternehmens mit rund 6‘000 Mitarbeitern. Wir konzentrieren uns auf die Planung und Realisierung von biotechnologischen, pharmazeutischen und chemischen Projekten im Bereich Produktion, Forschung und Entwicklung. Dank unserer integralen Dienstleistungspalette und der starken Kundenorientierung hat Morgan Sindall in der DACH-Region und darüber hinaus eine führende Marktstellung erreicht. Im Rahmen des weiteren Ausbaus suchen wir eine erfahrene und dynamische Persönlichkeit als: Asset Master Data Specialist - Pharma (w/m)Schweiz - BaselDeine Aufgaben:Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für Masterdaten, die zum Asset Management und Instandhaltung von pharmazeutischen Anlagen benötigt werden. Dieses beginnt bei der Ermittlung der Daten und setzt sich fort mit dem Erfassen der Daten in der Instandhaltungssoftware bis hin zur späteren Verwaltung und Pflege der Daten über den gesamten Lebenszyklus einer Anlage. Ausserdem sind folgende Aufgaben essentieller Bestandteil Deines Verantwortungsbereichs:  Identifzieren und Sammeln von Anlagendaten aus verschiedenen Quellen (e.g. Hersteller, Lieferant, Engineering Department) Aufsetzten der Functional Locations Structures (FLOC) von Anlagen in SAP-PM Registrierung von Anlagen und Ersatzteilen mit ihren relevanten Daten in SAP-PM bzw. SAP-MM Massenmutation von Daten Erstellen und Anpassen von Wartungsplänen, Kalibrierplänen, Arbeitslisten und Ersatztteillisten Überwachung und Kontrolle von SAP Notifications und Arbeitsaufrägen (Work orders) Planung und Implementierung aller Instandhaltungsaktivitäten (Zeit / Ressourcen / Material) in enger Abstimmung mit den betroffenen Abteilungen (Produktion, Supply Chain, Technik etc.) Koordination von internen und externen Ressourcen Einholen von Offerten für Instandhaltungsleistungen und -material Erstellen von Bestellanforderungen und Dokumentation in SAP Auswertung der Planerfüllung, Rückmeldungen und Ableiten von Verbesserungsvorschlägen Zusammenarbeit mit den Instandhaltungs-, Techniker- und Engineering Teams bei unseren Kunden Hauptnutzer von SAP und erster Anprecher von SAP Anwendern aus den Betrieben bezüglich Training, Coaching, Problembehebung  Dein Profil:Du bist eine leistungsstarke, ausdauernde und teamfähige Persönlichkeit und hast Erfahrung in der Verwaltung von Anlagenstammdaten und deren Anforderungen. Was Dich auszeichnet:  Technische Ausbildung (Ingenieur, Techniker, Informatiker) Mind. 2-3 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Stammdatenverwaltung in SAP-PM und SAP-MM in Bezug auf Instandhaltung von Produktionsanlagen im Pharma Kenntnisse über Anforderungen aus der Pharmaindustrie bezüglich Datenmanagement (Änderungs- und Abweichungsmanagement und Good Documentation Practice) Sehr gute Kenntnisse von MS-Office Flexiblität bezüglich Arbeitstätigkeiten und Arbeitsort (innerhalb der CH, gelegentlich im Ausland) Kommunikative Persönlichkeit mit grosser Kundenorientierung Gute Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift  Zusatzqualifikationen, die Dich hervorheben:  Kenntinsse im Aufsetzen und Verwalten von Datenbanken (Massenmutation, Datenvalidierung) Erfahrungen in Matrix Organizations Praxiserfahrung in der Instandhaltung  Deine Zukunft:Dich erwartet eine interessante Herausforderung für die Gestaltung Deines Verantwortungsbereichs sowie die Chance, Dich in einem vielseitigen, dynamischen Unternehmen mit einem motivierten Team fachlich und persönlich weiterzuentwickeln. Dein Arbeitsort ist die Region Basel mit Einsatzorten in der D-A-CH Region. Dein nächster Schritt:Klicke bitte auf "Bewerben" und fülle das Bewerbungsformular aus. Dies ermöglicht uns eine schnellstmögliche Bearbeitung Deiner Bewerbung. Alternativ kannst Du Deine Bewerbung auch per Post direkt an die unten angegebene Anschrift senden.   Morgan Sindall Professional Services ist stolz darauf, ein Arbeitgeber zu sein, der sich der Chancengleichheit verschrieben hat und allen Mitarbeitern und Bewerbern unabhängig von Alter, Geschlecht, Rasse, Religion, sexueller Orientierung, Behinderung oder ethnischem Hintergrund Beschäftigungsmöglichkeiten (EEO) bietet.   Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!            Morgan Sindall Professional Services AG HR Abteilung Badenstrasse 3 CH-4057 Basel      ZurückBewerben         Display original ad

Job title: (Senior) DMPK/PD Leader Small molecules, pRED Pharmaceutical Sciences
Content: (Senior) DMPK/PD Leader Small molecules, pRED Pharmaceutical Sciences At Roche, we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives and we are fearless in both decision and action.    That is why we come to work every single day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigor, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.   Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) translates extraordinary science into medical innovation through a diversity of technologies and talent located across seven research sites worldwide. We deliver on individual patient needs through a deep understanding of disease biology and the implementation of Personalized Healthcare strategies.   You would like to play an active part in doing now what patients need next ?     The Position:  Pharmaceutical Sciences (PS) is a global function within Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED). We enable discovery and early development of drug candidates in a rich portfolio of small molecules, large molecules, oligonucleotides and gene therapies in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, ophthalmology, rare and infectious diseases. We are currently moving over 150 projects through the value chain.    As DMPK-PD Leaders in PS, we provide innovative DMPK and translational PK/PD strategies to the entire pRED portfolio, bridging from in-silico and in-vitro systems or pre-clinical species into humans, from early discovery all the way through to registration and beyond. We are a multinational group and our working language is English.   We are looking to expand our team !    In this role your main responsibilities are to    be a key contributor to aid the selection and timely development of new drug candidates, through close interaction with therapeutic areas, medicinal chemistry, and affiliated non-clinical, clinical and regulatory functions   represent PS in project teams and with accountability for optimal design and execution of DMPK and PK/PD strategies from discovery to entry into human and beyond..   Lead a team of PS Experts to provide integrated screening and translational strategies to the pRED portfolio   Represent PS at internal and external committees,Global Health Authority meetings and Due diligence teams   integrate knowledge and lead comprehensive investigations of all DMPK-PD related activities including strategic planning, designing of studies and data integration into phase transition and regulatory documents.   identify potential DMPK, PK/PD and safety related hurdles to drug development, design contingency plans and communicate solutions    Scout and pioneer new paradigms and technologies in close collaboration with internal and external partners      Additional responsibilities could include    scientific and people leadership and/or oversight of a disease area portfolio   mentoring of DMPK scientists and team members   lead or provide support to inter- and intra-departmental initiatives keeping us at the forefront of our science      Qualifications:  As the successful candidate for this highly demanding strategic role, you have a strong foundation in a relevant scientific discipline with several years of post- doctoral experience. In particular, we appreciate the following   Experience in small molecule drug discovery   Experience in design and interpretation of PK/PD strategies    a solid understanding of pharmacological effects of drugs, physiological barriers and drug Physicochemical properties related to distribution and drug action   A good working knowledge of in-silico, in-vitro and in-vivo characterization of drug disposition, in vitro in vivo extrapolation (IVIVE) and PK/PD properties    Good Knowledge of PK/PD and the application of Modeling & Simulation in drug discovery   Understanding of PBPK principles and DDI risk assessment   excellent interpersonal skills, strong matrix leadership capabilities and collaborative attitude   Excellent communicator in English, able to convey complex matters in a concise and engaging way   Working knowledge of visualization and modeling tools such as Spotfire, Phoenix WinNonlin, GastroPlus, SimCYP, Berkley Madonna      Who you are:  You are curious and passionate about bringing drugs to patients with pragmatism and scientific rigour.    You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.   Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. Display original ad

Junior Data Analyst - Supply Chain (m/f/d)         Country:Switzerland   Job Function: Supply Chain Management  State / Province:Switzerland  Position Type: Full time  City / Location:Lucerne   Brand: adidas  Relocation:         Purpose:   Support the Global Customs team to ensure an effective and controlled customs operation which supports the business goals while providing guidance on customs related legal requirements on a global level.      Key Responsibilities:       Support data capture and reporting from Global Customs’ preference automation tool. Liaise with subsidiaries to monitor and report monthly performance. Escalate issues identified to management Assist in the set-up, development, implementation, communication and monitoring of customs compliance procedures programs within the adidas Group globally. Support Global Customs projects defined by VP Global Customs Support the calculation of assist costs to be declared globally Act as customs contact point for company-wide project requests Support broker selection and management process    Key Relationships:         Market Customs teams Supply Chain Management teams Group Finance adidas Sourcing Limited Global IT           Knowledge Skills and Abilities:    Proficient use of Microsoft office (Outlook, Word, Excel and Access) including Vlookup, pivot table and charts expertise. Knowledge of supply chain operations is an advantage Demonstrated business reasoning, analytical and critical thinking Good planning and organizational skills, and ability to work and deliver in dynamic environments while adhering to specified deadlines Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Knowledge of adidas based software (e.g. SIM, Tradecard, microstrategy, ILS) would be helpful    Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications:     A degree from an accredited college or university with emphasis on the areas of business, economics, logistics, supply chain, information system or operations or equivalent experience in customs business is preferable   Fluency in English, Written and Spoken          Posting Notes: Lucerne || Switzerland  || Switzerland  || || adidas || Europe, Middle East & Africa ||        Display original ad

Job title: Senior Data Analyst Product Owner Finance (h/f) - 100% 100%
Content: Senior Data Analyst Product Owner Finance (h/f) - 100% 100%      Senior Data Analyst Product Owner Finance   (h/f) - 100%    Votre mission    Analyser et documenter les besoins du département : données et développements Rédiger les users story (évolution ou restitution de données) Elaborer des concepts IT et des études de faisabilité S’assurer de la qualité des applications et/ou des données Prioriser les demandes au regard du Backlog Conceptualiser, designer, tester et implémenter des nouveaux processus business Restituer les informations aux services concernés Documenter les évolutions implémentées et contribuer à l’élaboration des procédures Créer, analyser et exploiter les sources de données DWH (tableau Software) Assurer le support aux utilisateurs et la coordination de certaines activités entre la finance et les autres départements   Votre profil     Vous êtes titulaire d’un diplôme universitaire ou d’une école supérieure spécialisée en Business analyse, une formation en finance serait un atout Vous possédez une expérience professionnelle dans l’analyse et la restitution des flux de données des processus métier, dans le contrôle qualité et dans le cadre d’une implémentation IT Vous maîtrisez les outils Office (Macro Excel) et SQL, une maîtrise des outils de gestion des requirements et des tests applicatifs serait un atout Vous avez de l’expérience dans la méthodologie Agile Vous êtes proactif, autonome et pourvu d’un bon esprit d’analyse Vous faites preuve d’un bon sens du détail et êtes organisé Vous disposez d’un excellent sens de la communication et adoptez une attitude orientée client Vous êtes de langue maternelle française, la maîtrise de l’anglais et de l’allemand serait un plus      3e acteur du domaine de l’assurance maladie en Suisse, Assura croit en la responsabilité partagée assureur-assurés et place cette conviction au cœur de son engagement en faveur du système de santé. Nos 1’300 collaboratrices et collaborateurs bénéficient de prestations sociales avantageuses et évoluent au sein d’un environnement de travail dynamique et collaboratif, porté par une culture d’entreprise et un esprit entrepreneurial forts ainsi que par un domaine d’activité utile et passionnant.     Entrée en fonction: De suite ou à convenir  Lieu de travail: Pully   Taux d'activité: 100%  Type de contrat: Indeterminé    Nous vous remercions pour l’intérêt que vous portez à notre société et nous réjouissons de prendre connaissance de votre postulation. Seules les candidatures sous format électronique seront prises en considération. La collaboration des agences de placement n’est pas souhaitée.    Merci de noter qu’ Assura est aidé par Serendi concernant les services d’acquisition des talents. Serendi, le fournisseur d’externalisation du processus de recrutement, est exclusivement en charge du poste mentionné ci-dessus. Vos données sont gérées selon les directives de conformités du groupe. Si vous avez des questions, notre recruteur sera ravi d’y répondre. www.serendi.com (Serendi SA, Avenue de la Gare 2, CH-1700 Fribourg)   Display original ad

Job title: Data Analyst Center of Competence Client Tax within Regulatory Strategy & Business Change
Content: Data Analyst Center of Competence Client Tax within Regulatory Strategy & Business Change Data Analyst Center of Competence Client Tax within Regulatory Strategy & Business Change #133944 Switzerland-Switzerland - Region Zurich-Zürich |    Full-time (FT) | Corporate Functions | Job ID 133944Risk ManagementEnglish  Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.   We Offer      A challenging key role as Senior Data Analyst within the Center of Competence Client Tax key regulatory topics for both our Swiss Universal Bank as well as International Wealth Management divisions   As part of the Center of Competence Client Tax a department in Regulatory Strategy & Business Change, you drive forward various data analytics topics across tax programs (e.g. FATCA, AEI, etc.) You take on responsibility for streamlining processes by means of automation being at the heart of Client Communication, Front Interaction and Interaction with Senior Management.    You lead meaningful data analysis topics across different Tax areas (FATCA, AEI, etc.)You provide and coordinate the creation of data reports   You impact assessments, analysis and deep dives for Senior Management   You proactively seek to improve all aspects of data delivery (in collaboration with Client Data Officers) by means of automation and optimization of tasks using new implementations and introducing new tools   With your highly motivated attitude you act as Subject Matter Expert on data for client structures and tax profiles used to prompt Tax Reportings   You provide thought leadership and support on related topics such as Data Quality management, KPIs/KRIs and overall approach to data for Tax topics   We offer you a chance to become a member of a highly dedicated and experienced team of qualified individuals within a dynamic and diverse international environment           You Offer    A university degree in Economics, Mathematics, Physics or Econometrics, or an equivalent education   You bring a minimum of 3 years of work experience within a leading international financial institution in a quantitative topic   Good language skills in English, German would be an additional asset   You have already demonstrated your strong analytical skills in various occasions   You have excellent knowledge in SQL, MS Access and VBA, other programming languages are certainly a plus   Initial knowledge of FATCA & AEI would be a strong benefit    Beside an extended technical knowledge, you are able to communicate the results (reports, issues, etc.) efficiently and in ways appropriate to those being addressed   You are willing to serve as a bridge between IT and the business – we are looking for someone who understands the overall IT systems implementation in depth and their impact on the data but also understands the business needs   You have a solid track record of working independently but also as a part of a team   You are a reliable person that works in a thorough way with dedication for analytical topics      *LI-CSJOB* Mr. T. Baumgartner would be delighted to receive your application.  Please apply via our career portal.   Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. Display original ad

Job title: Business Processes Associate Consultant (w/m) als Technical Data Analyst
Content: Business Processes Associate Consultant (w/m) als Technical Data Analyst      Requisition ID: 223858 Work Area: Consulting and Professional Services Expected Travel: 0 - 70% Career Status: Graduate Employment Type: Regular Full Time    COMPANY DESCRIPTION SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures. SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.    INHALTE UND ZIELE  In Consumer Industrie Services betreuen wir Kundenprojekte in den Themen Forecasting, Replenishment, Planning sowie Predictive Analytics. Schwerpunkt der Tätigkeit sind die Durchführung von komplexen statistischen und logistischen Wertschöpfungsanalysen sowie die Ermittlung von Optimierungspotentialen. Ein weiterer Tätigkeitsbereich ist der Einsatz und die Weiterentwicklung unserer Werkzeuge und Methoden im Bereich Massendatenverarbeitung und Datenbanken. Für unser Team suchen wir Verstärkung mit mathematischen oder technologischen Schwerpunkten, im Idealfall mit Know How in beiden Bereichen.    AUFGABEN   Durchführung von komplexen Optimierungsanalysen mit grossen Datenmengen Lösen von komplexen Fragestellungen für unsere Kunden unter Einsatz von SAP Predictive Analytics Werkzeugen Vorbereitung und Durchführung von Präsentationen vor unseren internationalen Kunden Vertriebsunterstützung sowohl für Softwareprodukte als auch für Beratungsleistungen Beratung in konzeptionellen und organisatorischen Fragestellungen      AUSBILDUNG UND QUALIFIKATIONEN / FÄHIGKEITEN UND KOMPETENZEN   Sie haben einen sehr guten Studienabschluss der Fachrichtung Mathematik, Informatik oder Ingenieurswesen Naturwissenschaft oder verfügen über eine alternative adäquate Ausbildung mit entsprechender Berufserfahrung In Ihrer bisherigen beruflichen Laufbahn konnten Sie mindestens zwei Jahre Berufs-/Beratungserfahrung sammeln, vorzugsweise im Bereich Handel und/oder Statistik Fundierte SQL Kenntnisse sind Voraussetzung Neben Ihrer Fachkompetenz zeichnen Sie sich durch Teamgeist, hohe Einsatzbereitschaft, Mobilität, Flexibilität, Belastbarkeit und ausgezeichnete Kommunikationskompetenz sowie eine selbständige und systematische Arbeitsweise aus Sie sprechen fließend Deutsch und Ihr Englisch ist verhandlungssicher Sie arbeiten strukturiert, zielgerichtet und legen großen Wert auf Genauigkeit     WHAT YOU GET FROM US  Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.   SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company. SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. Job title: Data Analyst / Modeler in Credit Risk Management for the Mortgage Portfolio
Content: Data Analyst / Modeler in Credit Risk Management for the Mortgage Portfolio Data Analyst / Modeler in Credit Risk Management for the Mortgage Portfolio #141330 Switzerland-Switzerland - Region Zurich-Zürich |    Full-time (FT) | Corporate Functions | Job ID 141330Risk ManagementEnglish  Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.   We Offer    A key role in the credit portfolio management team within Credit Risk Management Swiss Universal Bank with a strong focus on the mortgage portfolio including the real estate collaterals! In this role you will model and analyse big data around our mortgage portfolio and present your results in concise reports with the aim to identify inherent risks and drive and support risk management discussions and decisions Identify significant risks and data weaknesses in the portfolio using statistical techniques and quantitative models Support defining credit risk appetite on different levels (e.g. Business Areas) within SUB including the respective portfolio reporting and monitoring Perform and ensure timely delivery of regular and ad-hoc analysis and reporting to senior management The chance to develop understanding of credit risk in the mortgage business from a broad perspective and across the value chain The opportunity to interact with credit risk managers across different Credit Risk functions as well as management A role that marries quantitative analysis techniques with practical knowledge of credit risk and the underlying business rationale Being part of a dynamic, open and very collaborative working environment        You Offer  Bachelor's / Master’s degree in Banking & Finance, quantitative Finance, Econometrics or another quantitative discipline and 3 - 5 years of experience in banking, preferably in a quantitative role. Strong coding skills in at least one programming language (e.g. R, Python) and experience in handling big data Are you are a self-starter with a can-do attitude and strong analytical mindset paired with strong communication skills in proficient English and good German? Experience in credit risk management and in the mortgage business would be a big asset. Good interpersonal skills set and a high level of dedication and flexibility Contribute to our team with drive and enthusiasm to follow through on tasks and be persistent in face of challenges with data sourcing and reporting      *LI-CSJOB*Mr. M. Payer would be delighted to receive your application.Please apply via our career-portal.  Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. Display original ad

Job title: Data Analyst Ops Planning & Steering (80-100%, all genders)
Content: Data Analyst Ops Planning & Steering (80-100%, all genders) Help us actively shape and promote the digitalization of the Lufthansa Group! As a team player in our IT to Business Alignment unit, you will turn challenges into innovative solutions for our Ops Planning & Steering. You will partner up with our business units and our IT service providers. And you’ll delight in transforming pain points into appealing apps. So if you’re the type to pour all your passion and your energies into interpreting extensive data, and for whom “that won’t work” or “we’ve tried that already” only makes you more determined, come aboard!  Your responsibilities   Continuously and proactively identify drivers of performance and business insights by BI tools, analyze impacts of taken actions to give deep analytical insight to the different stakeholders Define, implement and measure process KPIs and conduct a process performance measurement cycle for Ops Control & Steering Design standard report portfolio with optimal layouts for management and operational teams Implement statistical forecast models Work out project proposals with goals, resources, milestones and costs Leading IT projects up to and including their operational handover Developing test procedures and conducting tests Active collaborations with various organizations within the Lufthansa Group.    Your profile    University degree with a quantitative focus for example in Mathematics, Business Administration, Statistics or similar First working experiences in an analytics context Experience in reporting/data visualization software, ideally Tableau Advanced skills in SQL, experience in programming would be an advantage Experience in IT project management (Agile certification an advantage) Experience in requirements engineering An ability to familiarize yourself swiftly and independently with new topic areas A strong analytical thinking approach and structured working methods Good written and verbal communication skills in German and English and ability to work in cross cultural environments.      Details   Employment level: 80-100% Department: IT to Business Alignment  Work place: Zurich, Kloten Starting date: ASAP Application deadline: November 20, 2019   You’ll find an interesting video profile of one of the current members of our SWISS IT team at: https://youtu.be/Zx6OoJX9ROs    Contact  Head of IT to Business Alignment Flight & Ground Ops: Mr. Fredy Wehrli Human Resources: Mr. Fabrice Wisler Recruiting Support: Tel.: +41 44 564 44 22  You may apply in English or German. Sr Associate Quality Control, Microbiology    Job Description   The main responsibilities for the Quality Control Sr. Associate I Microbiology will include execution of all of the Microbiology related testing activities at Biogen’s new large scale manufacturing facility in Solothurn, Switzerland. The Quality Control Sr. Associate will also be accountable to support the proper IQ / OQ / PQ of instrumentation and method validation in alignment with Biogen and Industry standards in collaboration with the Aanlytical Scientist. Microbiology related analysis at the site will include: microbiological identification, bacterial endotoxin test (kinetic-chromogenic), detection of microorganisms (BacT/Alert) and microbial enumeration test. Additional tests will include Total Organic Carbon and Conductivity. Automated/rapid as well as traditional methods will be applied. As the facility is being finalized for drug substance production, the Quality Control Sr Associate will support the facility certification with respect to the environmental monitoring (EM) and utility monitoring (UM).  Work in-progress (WIP) laboratories will be embedded into, or adjacent to, the manufacturing workspace at Biogen’s new facility. All operations at the facility will be focused on batch production and release of the drug substance materials produced at the site. The Quality Control Sr Associate has to support all activities to ensure that the instrumentation in these WIP labs is prepared for each corresponding unit operation to be performed in manufacturing. The Quality Control Sr Associate will also be accountable to support training of the On-The Floor (OTF) Quality staff members that will perform routine test execution. While the OTF staff will have accountability for routine test execution, trouble shooting of analytical or assay related issues will be supported by the Quality Control Sr Associate. Analytical methods or techniques requiring segregation from the manufacturing areas will be maintained in a central laboratory adjacent to the manufacturing buildings. Techniques to be performed in the central laboratory will include growth promotion test, microbial enumeration of in-process and EM/UM samples, Bacterial Endotoxin Test (kinetic-chromogenic) and microbiological identification.  The Quality Control Sr Associate should have a strong background in microbiological analytical methodologies. The Quality Control Sr Associate is expected to become a technical expert for classical and rapid methods and its instrumentation. The Associate has to correctly work with cGMP regulated computerized systems which are necessary for the testing workflow as these systems will support the vision of establishing a paper-less lab and ensure the relevant data integrity. The Quality Control Sr Associate will support the Microbiology Team with establishing analytical procedures and protocols related to microbiological analysis. The Quality Control Sr Associate will strongly support all compliance aspect related to analytical testing and will support investigations and root cause analysis. The Quality organization at the new Solothurn site is envisioned to be supported by team members with diverse backgrounds that are capable of cross functional work to support the high throughput design of the facility. As the site moves through the design phase into operational readiness, Quality staff will be focused on incorporating a new operations strategy into the quality management systems, lab systems and business systems. The operational strategy strongly relies on the incorporation of online real-time monitoring, automation of routine testing wherever possible and integrated information technology systems to bring transparency to routine business operations. As such, experience with electronic batch records and integrated sampling plans would be of advantage.   Accountability Description:   1. Support the preparation of the Microbiology lab and WIP lab for routine operations and support the execution of analytical capability strategy. Work cross functionally to support purchasing, receipt, IQ/OQ/PQ of analytical equipment for the Solothurn site. 2. Perform all analytical activities for equipment qualification and validation of microbiological methods and subsequent routine operations 3. Support the facility certification and establishment of the environmental and utility monitoring program for the site. Support day to day operations within the Central and WIP labs.  4. Author, review and approve complex GMP documentation (Plans, protocols, procedures, specifications, CAPAs, deviations, etc.) requiring the ability to grasp and apply regulatory and compliance knowledge from multiple markets/agencies     Qualifications     Education:Apprenticeship degree (Laborant EFZ) in Biology or related Life Science or Technical discipline.  Strong experience within Biological Quality Control, Microbiology and analytical function. Approximately 8 plus years of experience in pharmaceutical or biotech manufacturing environment.   Must have proficiencies with the Quality systems and business processes associated with Microbiology testing (drug substance)   Must have strong technical skills and be proficient with typical productivity software (Word, Excel, Power Point, Visio, etc.)   Strong analytical skills in Microbiology and compliance aspects  Must have a working understanding of modern analytical microbiological modalities to facilitate the execution of analytical quality strategies Demonstrated problem solving skills Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and cross-functionally Strong oral and written communication skills and ability to communicate with all levels of management, peers, contractors and external partners effectively Ability to multi-task Strong presentation and organizational skills Dual Language preferred with a preferences for German and English.   Display original ad

Job title: Senior UmweltnaturwissenschafterIn / GeologIn Altlasten und Baugrund
Content: Senior UmweltnaturwissenschafterIn / GeologIn Altlasten und Baugrund  Switzerland - Solothurn, Olten  Job Summary    Fully qualified scientist. Utilizes scientific principles, theories, practices and existing technologies to develop technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems.   Requires general familiarity within a broad field of scientific knowledge of reciprocal effects of the work upon other disciplines/fields.   Interprets and records data, conducts analyses, compares findings to relevant studies and local, state, and federal regulations to ensure compliance.   Works under only general direction. Independently determines and develops approach to solutions.   Solves problems by use of combinations of standard procedures, modifications of standard procedures or methods developed in previous assignments.   Participates in planning required to achieve prescribed objectives.   Conducts analysis and investigation work obtained from a variety of sources.   Performs inspections and tests to ensure compliance.   Participates in developing corrective measures and procedures. Formulates hypothesis, performs research and makes recommendation.   Ihre Aufgaben   Sie leiten selbständig Projekte in den Bereichen Altlasten, Gebäudeschadstoffe und Ingenieurgeologie   Sie sind für die interne Qualitätssicherung und das fachliche Review bei einem Grossprojekt mit rund 40 Mitarbeitern in der Schweiz und Deutschland zuständig   Sie koordinieren Projekte mit unseren Kunden und Partnern    Minimum Requirements  Ihr Profil   Sie sind GeologIn, IngenieurgeologIn, UmweltnaturwissenschafterIn oder UmweltingenieurIn   Sie bringen eine mehrjährige praktische Erfahrung als Projektleiter mit und kennen sich auch in komplexeren Sanierungsprojekten aus   Sie sind anpackend und übernehmen gerne Verantwortung   Sie können sich in Deutsch, Englisch und wenn möglich auch in Französisch gewandt ausdrücken   Sie sind ein Teamplayer, können gut mit Mitarbeitern umgehen und ordnen sich auch in eine grössere Organisation gut ein    Preferred Qualifications  .  What We Offer  When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity and overall employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. Job title: Senior ETL Informatica and Oracle Developer - 4094
Content: Senior ETL Informatica and Oracle Developer - 4094Geneva Senior ETL Informatica and Oracle Developer - 4094  Introduction  Digital transformation in the workplace is key to changing business. Our experts are known to give the best experience to our clients. Are you excited about the ultra-connected workplace? Fast-paced environment? Career path? Do you want to be part of the digital revolution in the workplace? Then you’ll be right at home working with our diverse teams who are helping our clients through this change.  Responsibilities  As part of the data network urbanization policy, we are looking for an Informatica & Oracle Senior ETL Developer to strengthen the Data Distribution and Data Integration team about 5 people.     Under the supervision of the project manager and the Lead developer and in collaboration with the Data Analyst, you will take care of all the assigned developments (mainly ETL Informatica on Oracle bases); Respect of the standards defined by the Lead developer, and those defined by the release management framework; Unit tests, integration, and technical tests; Documentation.  Your Profile   Very good development skills ETL Informatica (minimum 3 years of experience); Very good modeling and development skills on Oracle databases (minimum 3 years of experience); Agile development methodology; Experience with Oracle PL / SQL development; Fluency in French and English;  A sense of analysis, organized and rigorous; Curious and quick to learn; Management of problems with autonomy; Very good integration ability in a team composed of senior citizens; Good communication, impeccable presentation, solution-oriented, and customer oriented; Innovative and pragmatic.   What you’ll get from us?   Excellent opportunity to grow in an International company; Awesome work environment; Be part of our global network brand.    Azure DevOps Engineer - 4394Geneva

Job title: Senior Business Analyst Regulatory & Compliance, 100% in Zürich w/m
Content: Senior Business Analyst Regulatory & Compliance, 100% in Zürich w/m     Senior Business Analyst Regulatory & Compliance  Wir haben uns im Bereich der Finanzdienstleistungen spezialisiert und legen Wert auf Qualität und Kompetenz. Um dies zu gewährleisten, verfügt die AMPS über Mitarbeiter mit fundierter Bank- und Informatik-Ausbildung, sowie mehrjähriger Projekterfahrung in den Bereichen der Projektleitung, der Business Analyse und der Qualitätssicherung. Als Business Analyst im Kontext der AMPS, sind Sie zuständig für die Aufnahme und Bearbeitung von Anforderungen an IT-Systeme. Sie arbeiten direkt an der Schnittstelle zwischen Business und IT. Mithilfe Ihrer Arbeit, werden Geschäftsprozesse unserer Kunden digitalisiert.  Ihre Aufgaben:   Mitarbeit im Projektteam als Fachspezialist Regulatory/Compliance Optimieren der Anti Money Laundering (AML) Prozesse: Know your customer (KYC), Media Screening, AML Analytics, AML Rule Based Monitoring, AML Workflow Analysis Datenanalyse, Auswertung und Ableitung von Anforderungen an die IT Systeme Erstellen von Business-Spezifikationen für die Integration der neuen Funktionalitäten Abstimmen der Anforderungen mit den Stakeholdern Testfälle erstellen Modellieren und beschreiben der Anforderungen und Sicherstellung der Implementierung Ansprechpartner für Business und IT Beraten von internen sowie externen Ansprechpartner Durchführen von Präsentationen, Reviews, Workshops und Teilnahme an Projektstatusmeetings Einführen von Analyse- und Modellierungsstandards Übernahme von Koordinations- und Prozessaufgaben     Ihr Profil   Mehrjährige Erfahrung mit AML Fachthemen: KYC, Media Screening, AML Analytics, AML Rule Based Monitoring, AML Workflow Analysis, Client Rating Tools und Methodologie Datenanalyst Sie haben Erfahrung mit dem agilen Projektvorgehen (Scrum/SAFe) Sie sprechen Deutsch Sie sind eine kommunikative Persönlichkeit, welche die Sprache des Fachbereichs und der IT versteht Sie haben mehrjährige Erfahrung als Business Analyst im Bereich Private Banking Sie wenden klassische UML Diagramme an Sie modellieren Geschäftsprozesse auf Basis von BPMN 2.0 Sie stellen sich gerne neuen Herausforderungen Sie verfügen über ein sicheres auftreten Sie verfügen über eine analytische und strukturierte Vorgehensweise Sie verstehen den Softwareentwicklungsprozess und die Tätigkeiten im Projektgeschäft End-to-End Sie können Ihre Anliegen gegenüber Anspruchsgruppen durchsetzen     Unser Angebot   Wir sind in anspruchsvollen Projekten im Bereich der Finanzdienstleistung an der Schnittstelle zwischen Business und IT tätig Wir ermöglichen unseren Mitarbeitern Einsätze in verschiedenen Projekten und Rollen Wir haben attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen Wir bieten die Möglichkeit, aktiv an der Gestaltung der AMPS mitzuwirken Wir arbeiten in einem dynamischen und kollegialen Arbeitsumfeld Wir unterstützen Weiterbildungen Wir arbeiten im Raum Zürich   Kontakt  Fühlen Sie sich angesprochen? Job title: Senior Consultant / Manager Data Analytics (Advisory Deals)
Content: Senior Consultant / Manager Data Analytics (Advisory Deals)  Your tasks  You will be part of our Deals team and will be working on both client facing and internal projects. As data analytics expert, you will support the team on performing complex data analyses and interact with colleagues and clients to get the most valuable insights out of the available data.  You will take a role in the further upskilling of our Deals professionals in the use of state-of-the-art data analytics tooling in their daily work. You will also work with colleagues of other Data Analytics teams within PwC and our European Data & Analytics Center of Excellence in Munich. You will be part of an innovative and motivated team and have the possibility to bring in own ideas and help designing different concepts. You will be able to combine your skills in data analysis with a job as management consultant and ideally your experience from the business side.    Your profile  You have a degree in mathematics, engineering, computer science or business administration with a quantitative focus or a similar education (e.g. Master, PhD or MBA). You already have 3 to 5 years of experience as a data analyst, know statistical methods and can apply them. In addition, you have already gained experience in identifying relevant data sources, extracting data (e.g. from ERP systems) as well as ensuring data quality. You are proficient in how to deal with structured data in relational databases, in MS Office formats (e.g. Excel, Access) or text files (e.g. XML, CSV) and you have experience with data modelling tools (e.g. Alteryx, Matlab, etc.), programming languages (R, Python) as well as reporting and visualization solutions (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, etc.). You like to work both on innovation as well as on client projects. You have a natural interest to work on analyses in a wide range of areas, including financial and operational data and geospatial analysis.  You are a team player, motivated to learn new things and you like to work in a client-oriented way. You are fluent in English (written and spoken), knowledge of German is a plus.    Who we are – PwC as an employer  At PwC, we create value for both our people and clients in Assurance, Tax & Legal, Consulting, Deals and Digital Services. And you can do the same. Want to make an impact and shape the future of a leading professional services firm? Are you passionate and ready to embrace change? Then you've got what it takes to reimagine the possible. Everyone's career path is unique. That's why PwC offers countless personal and professional development opportunities that fit with your aspirations, supporting you to grow your own way – so you can become everything you want to be and more. More about Advisory Display original ad

Data Sourcing, Integration & Transformation Data Sourcing, Integration & Transformation #140519 Switzerland-Switzerland - Region Zurich-Zürich |    Full-time (FT) | Corporate Functions | Job ID 140519Legal & ComplianceEnglish  Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.   We Offer    We are offering an interesting role as Data Sourcing, Integration and Transformation specialist supporting multiple initiatives in the Client Lifecycle Management area     The role includes:        identifying Golden sources for requested datasets, negotiating and documenting Data Delivery Agreements, coordinating with various IT teams the delivery of the negotiated feeds setting up data ingestion pipelines and data quality checks analyzing, transforming and normalizing the data This work will take place on the Big Data Platform (Palantir Foundry) and depending on the workload it may also include the processing of the normalized data as per the requirements of the various projects In addition, you will act as an advisor to multiple initiatives related to Client Lifecycle Management, informing them on the possibilities of the data that already exists on the Platform and analyzing the impact of their requirements to other in-flight projects. Last but not least, you will be partnering together with the DTPL Functional Architecture team to define the strategic priorities for transforming and modularizing data-intensive applications and complicated data processing pipelines        You Offer  A degree in Software Engineering, Information Technology, Business Informatics or a related field (or provable equivalent practical experience in this domain) You have prior experience as a developer, database administrator, data analyst or ETL specialist (and preferably knowledge of Python) You combine good interpersonal and communication skills together with a positive personality and can-do / self-starter attitude. You have the ability to work independently with partners from multiple regions, backgrounds and levels (Staff to Managing Directors) You have the ability to learn fast and become familiar with new concepts, systems and processes. You are structured and detail-oriented, value well-written documentation and have a passion for technical excellence and lifelong learning Very good command of the English language    *LI-CSJOB* J. Albinus would be happy to receive your application.Please apply via our career portal.   Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. Display original ad

Global Digital Media Manager       ABOUT LA PRAIRIE   La Prairie is the leader in luxury skincare, present in 90 countries around the world.Synonymous not only with luxury, the La Prairie name evokes innovation, performance, high-touch service and Swissness — the purity, precision and excellence inherent to the extraordinary land that saw the brand’s inception in 1978.La Prairie endeavors to fulfill a quest for timeless beauty through the highest standards of advanced technology combined with exquisite formulations and elegant packaging — elevating science to art.        Global Digital Media Manager          Location:     Volketswil, CH          Contract Type:  Permanent - full-time         Description:      We are looking for a passionate, highly driven and intellectually curious Global Digital Media Manager, to join our dynamic and growing Global Digital & eCommerce team based at our headquarter near Zurich. Reporting to the Global Digital Marketing Manager, this role will offer you the unique opportunity to contribute at 2 levels:- strategic level: designing the Global Digital Media of the Brand and guidelines for Markets roll out- operational level: owning the design rollout of global campaigns and some regional digital media activations  Your Responsibilities   You define the main qualitative and quantitative objectives of the digital media strategy of the brand You identify and prioritize the relevant channels (Display, Video, Mobile, SEM, Social, Email, Recruitment …) with budget masses allocation You establish yearly global media plan and support regions and countries in defining theirs - in collaboration with global/local agency partners You contribute to 360 campaigns with innovative and relevant media ideas and guidelines to support product launches and key brand moments activation In collaboration with the creative studio, you lead production and localization of assets and coordinate with the digital team the needed landing pages and steer the trafficking/tracking process You organize the delivery of assets through the digital library to foster their usage You design KPIs and reporting structure of the campaigns / channels and secure correct tracking implementation You document guidelines for campaign creation, implementation and tracking You support the Global Digital Marketing Manager in the validation of local campaign request   Digital Campaigns ownership  You manage from A to Z the tactical Global Digital Campaigns In collaboration with the EMEA team you drive their digital media both for eCommerce and non eCommerce countries from media planning to roll out. You secure EMEA extra local campaign request bring complementarity to your global plan, and execute them through the same agency   Digital Media performance steering  In collaboration with the data analyst team, you produce web acquisition insights You maintain benchmark and develop testing strategies You pro-actively analyse and challenge data to identify actionable media improvements You prepare & animate monthly web acquisition committee, to ensure a cohesive full-funnel digital media strategy to reach monthly and yearly growth goals    Your Qualifications   You have minimum of 5 years of professional international experience in digital acquisition / ecommerce environment You are proficient and up-to-date with global media trends and tools (Display, Video, Mobile, SEM, Social, Email, Recruitment …). Experience in Asian specific platforms is a plus. You master the management of paid traffic acquisition up to the resonance on organic You are highly organized, very detailed-oriented, able to manage multiple projects in a deadline-driven environment You demonstrate resourcefulness to solve problems You show enthusiasm, commitment, creativity, and a positive attitude You have a keen interest in luxury, cosmetic industry, Switzerland and a multi-cultural environment Your English is fluent, any other language is a plus    We look forward to receiving your application!         Display original ad
